intro: Royena fischeri, commonly known as the Fischer's rockrose, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a distinctive red or purple calyx. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
